thread.title: Cavs' Love practices for first time since shoulder surgery | Basketball
thread.title_full: Cavs' Love practices for first time since shoulder surgery | Basketball | ArcaMax Publishing

author: arcamax.com
title: Cavs' Love practices for first time since shoulder surgery | Basketball
text:
INDEPENDENCE, Ohio -- Cavaliers forward Kevin Love returned to practice Saturday for the first time since injuring his shoulder last May and could appear in a preseason game on Thursday. He is not expected, however, to play Monday at Ohio State or Tuesday at home against the Milwaukee Bucks.
Love hinted he could play Thursday at home against the Indiana Pacers.
"I felt good. Just getting into the rhythm of the plays more than anything, just getting my legs under me and (taking) contact," Love said. "As time goes, I'll get more accustomed to being out there playing, but today was the first step."
All of these back-to-backs during the preseason have complicated the Cavs' plans. David Blatt said Saturday LeBron James will play in one of the games, either Monday or Tuesday, after James already declared he would play Monday at Ohio State. James has long had an affinity for the school and he enjoys playing preseason games in cities the Cavs don't visit during the regular season.
